website_summaries.verdict: Perfect for bad weather situations (or for construction workers), but serious hikers may want to look elsewhere for an everyday boot.
cons: May be too heavy for longer hikes

website_summaries.verdict: For those who seek a hiking or work boot that is comfortable almost straight out of the box, this is definitely one to consider.
pros: Very comfortable, with a short break-in period
cons: We suggest ordering a half-size smaller than usual for a better fit
Additional waterproofing treatment may be necessary

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Boot, But.....
customer_reviews.text: Very nice boot, seemingly well made and tough. I added an aftermarket padded insole and was immediately able to walk over 7 miles, three days in a row without a break-in period. HOWEVER, after just my fourth day of wearing these boots one of the riveted eyelets on the left boot broke and came out of the leather hole, so now I have to take it to shoe repair to get fixed (hopefully). If they can't fix it reasonably I'm sending them back. A shame because these are very comfortable boots. I should not have to pay for a repair because of shoddy craftsmanship. I'll revise the review as this issue progresses.
customer_reviews.author: Neil P.

customer_reviews.title: Warning:  Don't Do Business With ShoeBuy
customer_reviews.text: My husband loved these because they're lightweight like an athletic shoe but provide good support. However, after having worn them for less than two weeks one of the shoelace eyelet-rivets detached itself from the leather, rendering them useless. So disappointing. To make matters worse, the current seller ShoeBuy (used to be handled by Amazon) is not responding to refund requests, even though I've gone through all the proper channels.
customer_reviews.author: MizJones

customer_reviews.title: While the most comfortable, also the worst quality boots I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable pair of boots I have owened. However, the quality of the boot seems a bit to be desired. I ordered a pair on Oct 27, 2017. Loved them, however within a couple months they were no longer waterproof, then I started noticing them falling apart as you see in the pictures. I bought another pair in Dec 2017, and another pair in May of 2018 thinking that maybe I got a bad batch or something... nope, all three pairs are showing signs of falling apart, no longer waterproof, etc... I know I'm not buying a $300 pair of Red Wings, or Danners, but I would expect these to last longer than a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money or plan to lace up.
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking boot although did not even get to lace up. Put door in felt great pull the laces to tie the boot and top right eyelet pulls right outs. Seems I am not the first. Timberline use to be great brand. I guess I was hoping the many bad review were not going to be me. The rivet for the eyelet is about as cheap looking as they get. Definitely not WA state hiking worthy.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: SMH.
customer_reviews.text: Man, I'm so disappointed. I bought these for work, a few months back. I'm a mail carrier so I need something durable and WATERPROOF. The durability is great. I walk up to 15-18 miles a day. But at soon as it rained, I thought I was going to be okay... nope! My left for was entirely soaked! And I wasn't stepping in puddles just walking in the rain. Took 2 days to dry, then it rained again, now BOTH feet were SOAKED. SMH. They held up great to the point where I contemplated getting a second pair, but not being "waterproof" as they claimed, deal breaker. Won't buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: SheJay Scarlett

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: For the first six or seven months, the boots were great. Then they started falling apart. Fast. As you can see from the photograph. This is what they look like about 18 months after I started using them. For a few more dollars you can buy something a lot better. Never again, Timberland.
customer_reviews.author: cloudance

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof and wears very fast
customer_reviews.text: These boots are not waterproof. I treated them with mink oil before the first use and they still let water in. I hike through wet grass routinely and within 10 minutes I feel the water coming in. Within 20 minutes, my feet are saturated. What's worse is that the soles are wearing outrageously fast. The surface of the treads are already nearly flush and I can feel small pebbles and rocks as if I were wearing sneakers. If you buy these as a dry weather boot and never put them to any hard use, you may be happy, but don't bother if you want to really use them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Breathability = zero
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of things I like about these boots. They are very sharp looking and have stayed that way though several months of every other day wear with very little maintenance. The soles are very grippy in all types of conditions and temps. They are also extremely light and waterproof. Now the down side - they don't breath at all. My socks are soaked in a couple of hours of just sitting at a desk. They act like a pair of rubber boots. I still give high marks to them for all of the other good points, but if your feet perspire like mine then you need to bring along several pair of extra socks.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Happy with sizing and quality
customer_reviews.text: The sizing recommendation (1/2 size smaller than tennis shoe size) was spot on for me. I struggle when buying shoes online because I sometime fit in 11s, and sometimes fit in 11.5s. I took their recommendation and ordered 11's and they were a perfect fit. I've been on several multi-mile walks on pavement with them so far and no problems with blisters or fit right out of the box. Quality is nice. Haven't tested the waterproofing and hope not to, but purchased them with the intention to wear riding motorcycle in the off chance I get caught in the rain. Will update if they meet/exceed/fail expectations in the wet.
customer_reviews.author: Sprman

customer_reviews.title: Size 11 is a tight fit for a normal 11.
customer_reviews.text: First off, the shoe itself is great. It's the quality you expect from Timberland. However it's a tight fit. I wear a size 11 medium in just about everything. Shoes, sneakers, boots etc. My foot is normal to narrow. Wide shoes make my foot feel like it's swimming in the shoe. These shoes are Tight with a capital T. The toe box is extremely narrow and the heavy cushioning in the heel/ankle area forces your for forward. I expect these will take a lot of breaking in to feel right. I didn't return them for a larger size because I wanted a form fitting hiking boot. They are definitely waterproof though. 2 stars off for not running true to size
customer_reviews.author: L. A. Mahmud

customer_reviews.title: Cheap goes expensive
customer_reviews.text: FIRST..After many years wearing $100 Timberland boots to work on construction I decided to buy another style of boots with lower price, Supposedly they are waterproof but my opinion is that For a moderate rain they hold the water out but not for all day long. SECOND. I do not know how this happened but the second day of use when I realized there was a broken grommet and there are a second one about to come of. I honestly do not recommend these boots for construction works. Cheap goes expensive....
customer_reviews.author: marvin

customer_reviews.title: You want Vietnamese, NOT Cambodian build
customer_reviews.text: Some other review talked about "Country of Origin" and wow, couldn't be more true. Tried these exact boots on in DSW and was ready to purchase until I found them here 25% discounted. Fit and feel could NOT have been more different. Main difference was the DSW version were made in Vietnam, these were made in Cambodia. These were way smaller and of poorer build quality... stitching, gluing, color evenness. Well worth the extra $25 for the DSW Vietnamese version.
customer_reviews.author: Smeagol

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for long duration hiking as they are water resistant ...
customer_reviews.text: Not recommended for long duration hiking as they are water resistant and really keep in the sweat. They are stylish but have a very stiff ankle which did not seem to relax at all. Even layered with sock liners and wool socks the moisture did not seem to move away from my feet. Short hikes or fashion ok but not recommended for longer hikes where moist feet would be an issue. Shoes do scuff easily although overall they seem tough. Not sure amazon will allow me to post pricing but it was more then forty but less than fifty on sale. Highly recommended at that price.
customer_reviews.author: Bovineplane

customer_reviews.title: Materials broke down within three months.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these Timberlands for my husband as a Christmas gift. When he put them on they felt comfortable but began to rapidly fall apart. Within three months they were unusable. After years of purchasing the Timberland brand it appears that we may have to locate another brand unless Timberland stands by it's products and ships him a new pair. For what these cost you should get more than three months. If your just going to walk around in then they may work for you. We work on homes together and he's extremely disappointed because we've purchased dozens of pairs of Timberlands over the years without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Sportydog

customer_reviews.title: Cheap boots.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: lightweight, look good, mostly water resistant. Cons: Thin, cheap leather. Sole is Delaminating at toe. Thin footbed. Water resistance is fading as toe delaminates. L Only had these a couple of months and they are starting to fail. Quality is low grade department store caliper. I had a pair of these in the early nineties that lasted a decade. These ones will not make six months.
customer_reviews.author: Keek

customer_reviews.title: Don't understand the 5 star reviews
customer_reviews.text: Horrible, I don't understand the great reviews on this. I have other Timberland boots that are excellent, but these were unwearable. I can only conclude that this model isn't what it used to be when the older reviews were written. I ordered my normal size and they were very narrow, tight and stiff. The insoles were the worst part, hard as a rock and bumpy, very poor compared to the 20-some year old boots I want to replace. Some of the worst I've worn at this price range. The only thing I liked was the style and look. I prefer the metal lace hooks which these have. Disappointed, I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: icheckemout

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots but if your going to USE them be forewarned.
customer_reviews.text: I like these boots/hikers whatever. I use them for landscaping work so they get beat. This is my 6 or 7th pair over the years. The very first pair I bought lasted for 1 month 1 week until the sole separated. I went through 2 other pairs of different manufacturers boots before returning to these. Since then I have gone through 1 to 2 pairs of boots a season. Sometimes a pair will last the whole season but usually I replace them. If your using these as a fashion statement you'll be good to go. If you're hiking the AT plan on getting a new pair half way through.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Different from in-store purchases (buyer beware)
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this exact boot several times over the years in various shoe stores. This time I decided to buy it online and save a little money. However, after purchasing discovered this boot is hard as a rock. The main reason I liked this particular boot is that it has a "broken in" feel even when it's brand new. That was NOT the case with the online purchase. If you want a boot that feels like it's made of lead, go ahead and buy these online. Otherwise, just go to the store.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph T.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THESE BOOTS
customer_reviews.text: I PURCHASED THE TIMBERLAND BOOTS THROUGH AMAZON AND THE BOOTS STARTING FALLING APART WITHIN A WEEK. DESCRIPTION SAYS THEY ARE WATER RESISTANT AND THEY ARE NOT. I MADE A WARRANTY CLAIM TO TIMBERLAND AND THEY SAID THEY CAN'T HONOR THE WARRANTY BECAUSE THE BOOTS ARE NOT FOR WORK, I DID WEAR THEM TO WORK BUT MY JOB IS NOT DIFFERENT THAN HIKING. THEY'RE FULL OF COMPLAINS EVERYWHERE I AM NOT THE ONLY ONE WHO'S COMPLAINING ABOUT THESE BOOTS.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Bautista

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow, good for walking but not standing for long times.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these in wide size but they're still really narrow. More importantly they small inside, so even if it's wide enough for your feet, if you have a high instep or a chunky foot in general it's going to feel really cramped. It should be fine for people with smaller narrow feet. Oh, and it does bear mentioning that these are hiking boots. They're actually really good when walking, but while standing it's just not comfortable. That's probably why the fit is tighter in the first place, to really lock you down. Because of that, even though it failed me, it doesn't necessarily mean it's a bad boot.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Williams

customer_reviews.title: I want my old Timberlands, not these cheaply made ripoffs
customer_reviews.text: These seem like the kind of fake Timberlands you’d find at a street shop in Chinatown. I can’t believe how poorly constructed these are and why Timberland would use these cheap materials. I’ve owned several $100 pairs of Timberland hiking boots throughout the years and I feel ripped off after buying this pair. I’m returning these because I know they won’t last as long as the previous pairs I’ve owned.
customer_reviews.author: Colin B.

customer_reviews.title: If you want to do real hiking these are not the right boots, coming down Longs Peak today, I went trough hell.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible boots. Work great on a City Park trail, not on the mountain. Bad foot support, you will fell every stone, boulder, rock and everything in between with you foot twisting, bending and felling the squeeze. I had to glue them twice, they only had ~100miles, mostly on very easy trails. Coming down the mountain, they are horrible,looks like I’m going to loose a few toenails. Definitely spend your hard earned money on a different brand that offer a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: GHP

customer_reviews.title: lace rivets are trash
customer_reviews.text: a week after I bought these one of the eyes on the right boot tore free . they still lace up through the broken rivet hole but for brand new boots I expect more from timberland. I have a pair of boondocks now, but as I sit and look at these new no longer waterproof boots I am unhappy. and considering a different brand next time . I had a death in the family at the time so I didn't return them to amazon in a timely manner ,.. ugh a pair of replacement 12 wide boots would go a long way toward making me happy , and you can have the old boots back worn 2 times
customer_reviews.author: stephen sugalski

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots!
customer_reviews.text: I've been needing some hiking boots for a while and decided to purchase these before an upcoming camping trip. I was hesitant to buy boots online but since these had such good reviews, I took a chance and was pleasantly surprised. They fit me perfectly and were very comfortable from the start. They take a little while to break in but with some long socks, it's not too bad. I walked through a little water to test the waterproofing and had no issues. They clean pretty easily too. Overall, I feel these were a great buy and will update if the durability and quality turn our to be less than expected but so far these exceed all my expectations!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace worn out LL Bean Light hikers. LL Bean raises their price to $170. So I got these. These are a great fit, stayed waterproof for me with light walking on wet trails or wet grass. I never immersed these into a deep puddle Solid, holds up and lightweight. I like them so much, I bought a second pair for whenever these wear out. Actually I use these everyday for work and play.
customer_reviews.author: cyber

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these maybe 4 years ago and they were awesome. Not sure what happened since then, but they’re clearly not what they used to be. Very weird fit around the calf. Too much padding on sides of calf and heel not cupped well, and back is slightly angled forward, so you end up with your calf being jabbed by the back with too much padding preventing keeping your foot in place. Weird having no padding in back and too much on sides. Basically it’s angled like a snowboard boot. There’s no heel cup. The whole back is just angled forward. Weird. Usually you have a cup and then straight up. Highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: no

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these if you ever plan on walking on a wet surface
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. Not really waterproof as water gets in the tongue through the edge of the boot where the laces are. Extremely slippery and dangerous when walking on even a moderately wet surface. One would think that boots such as these would have some level of slip resistance. Any at all. They are billed as hiking boots. I can hardly envision hiking across wet river rocks with these when I am having difficulty staying upright walking on a FLAT surface (quarry tile no less) with a little water and debris on it. Essentially they are useless for the purpose with which I purchased them. Very disappointed. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: A man fond of Amazons

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what to make of  these pair of timberlands
customer_reviews.text: I did purchased these boots a while back . I actually put them in storage in my closet for quite a long time in their original box upon receiving them. I just started to use them on a day that was a little rain/sleet and discover that one of my boot became wet. Was very disappointed that a timberland boot that is supposed to be waterproof wasn't. I kept them in a dry closet like so many of my other boots which none of them ever leaked. This does lead me to believe that it was defective from the beginning and hope it is not the overall timberland quality. Had I discovered this earlier I would have returned.
customer_reviews.author: Gianni

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof and bad shoelaces set!!!
customer_reviews.text: We already know those boots are ugly even before we buy them but you would think "well, they are at least practical". Big mistake! Those boots are NOT WATERPROOF at all and I had my feet wet in both rain and snow days! Moreover, the shoelaces are somehow not very well attached to the boots so they get untied every time forcing you to stop walking to tie them! I am very disappointed with this order and will never buy them again!
customer_reviews.author: Jose SC

customer_reviews.title: Good boot at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these boots, so the review covers the latest ones and the prior ones that I replaced. These fit my wider feet perfectly, are comfortable, and waterproof for about a year with almost everyday use. The only downside to the white ledge is that the rubber separated at front of the toe area after about 15 months of hard use, and 18 months they were done for. The Chocurua is a bit more expensive but I think I will opt for them again on my next pair, as they were more durable and lasted me almost 4 years under the same conditions- almost everyday use, multitude of outside/inside conditions, wet, dirty, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Ty Dodge

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing these for a couple months now, zero complaints, except for the cheap laces they come with. Had to replace one after about a month, so I replaced with the 'wave' style which stays tied. Have not had any issue yet with the eyelets. I was struggling with planter faciitis so bought these for better support, they have not disappointed. Wear them daily and on motorcycle rides. Comfortable, warm, and so far, durable.
customer_reviews.author: jimb

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow and look plastic.
customer_reviews.text: These are so narrow and they look plastic. I took them out of the box and the first thing I thought was, they are plastic. They are not but even my wife thought they had that shiny plastic look. Ok, maybe it's the waterproofing and it'll get better. Then I went to try them on and they are so narrow. I have NEVER worn wide shoes. I don't know it they would widen after breaking them in but I can even get my foot in to try. Between the look and the fit they fail miserably. Back to Rockports.
customer_reviews.author: HTD

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, understated, and versatile
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for for a trip to Peru, and the price I got them for is great. I wore these in restaurants, bars, museums, walking, and hiking. I like that they're a plain, solid color with an understated logo, as opposed to most walking / hiking shoes. They got dusty and dirty but cleaned up easily with a damp paper towel. They're incredibly comfortable. I broke them in with one week of light wear before the trip and I never had any discomfort, pain, or blisters. I have high arches, but so far I haven't needed any extra support. I'll definitely purchase another pair when these wear out.
customer_reviews.author: K. Conroy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRICE WON’T FIND CHEEPER
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been buying these same Timberlands 8 plus years every 7-9 months. I work long shift on concrete ALL day. These boots hold up and are the most comfortable boots I’ve ever purchased. I’ve bought others in the years only to go back to these. I do use Dr. Scholls arch support insoles with all my shoes and boots. I have an unusual high arch. Also on the bottom of boots the sole has lil levels that wear over time and give you a good idea when to purchase a new pair instead of going through the pain of worn boots NOTE——NEVER PAID LESS THAN $100 IN RETAIL. GREAT PRICE FOR SAME BOOTS
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and comfort, questionable durability.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for around 2 months. So far, one of the speed lace eyelets broke off, and the rubber where the sole meets the toe is already coming loose. I feel like I'll be lucky to get a year out of them. That being said if I do, I will be satisfied. They fit well, and are comfortable. They were 63 dollars and are replacing much more expensive red wings which lasted 4 or 5 years. If these don't hold up I will be investing in the red wings again.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew DeWitt

customer_reviews.title: Not at all what I expected. Very unhappy. My money wasted again with Amazon Sellers
customer_reviews.text: My normal boot size is Size 9.5 and these boots were too small. Return requested for size 10. Received the size 10 and they are the exact same size as size 9.5 I initiated a return on since they came too small. Since I already tried on the size 9.5 and there is no noticeable size difference, I will just keep the original size 9.5 pair, which I still decided to hold on to. I will be cancelling the original return and return the size 10. What a fun around for just trying to get boots. I am not sure where these are being manufactured but I know these boots are not running true to size.
customer_reviews.author: Mendo View

customer_reviews.title: Size of right boot at the front part, was somehow too tight.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased Timberland products for many years now, this last deal regarding to the waterproof boots, brown, was a flop. My size is US 9, always fit properly, this time I I wore the shoe only at home for a couple of days and set for a 5km outdoor, after a while i suffered very strong pains in the right lower part of my foot, since the shoe front part was a little bit too small and tight couldn't even press the brake pedal of my car. I cannot use it at all. I'm sure an half size larger would make the solution.
customer_reviews.author: Moshe

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about buying a hiking boot as a work boot, but being a landscaper, my needs don't exactly fit a standard work boot's intended use. I've owned it about a month now and I'm more than satisfied. The lace eyelet design is superb, they are all metal and they allow you to really cinch them to your ankle very tight. The waterproofing is great, they were comfortable after one shift of breaking them in. They don't slip or rub anywhere. If they fall apart on me I will update my review, but all things considered, I'm extremely happy with them
customer_reviews.author: Bushcraft710

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the BEST! Or So I Previously Thought
customer_reviews.text: ***UPDATE*** After 9 months of use, doing basic yard work, the toe wrap is completely coming apart from the upper leather. I am trying to glue back together, as you will see in pictures. Obviously, the quality of the new shoes is NOT the same as the pair of older shoes. Shoes that cost $79+ should provide much longer use than 9 months...shame on Timberland!!! - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - This is my second pair of same boots. First pair lasted 14 years. They are really good boots! Very comfortable and stylish.
customer_reviews.author: BKM

customer_reviews.title: Steer clear.
customer_reviews.text: HOT GARBAGE. You can’t wear these boots for more than 8-9 hours. Since Timberland dropped their partnership with Goretex the products no longer have that stay dry tech that you need to get through a work day. I actually got a rash on my inside ankle after taking a shower, drying my feet thoroughly, putting on very high quality socks, and wearing these on a 12 hour shift. Look anywhere else for quality boots, a few that I’d recommend: Merrells Redwing Under Armour- I’m on my second pair Literally any other brand.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Great boot! ... So far
customer_reviews.text: Money is tight and I needed a good boot for the slushy, snowy, hiking season in Colorado. I opened the box last week and these boots looked great. I like the leather because it's more durable and less likely to leak. I've hike three times in these boots already in snow, mud, slush. Up and down pretty steep hills and they seem waterproof. These boots got wet and my feet were dry! I'm impressed. Now, they don't really breath and my feet were wet with perspiration but for $70, these boots are da bomb! I like their light weight too.
customer_reviews.author: Longmont Joe

customer_reviews.title: The BEST shoe I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: The price is good considering the excellent quality of this shoe. It is also waterproof, saving me the work of applying oil to the leather like I normally would. I ordered 2 different brands of shoe from Amazon, which I had to return, and finally decided to try a brand I have never tried before. This is the most comfortable shoe I have ever worn, right out of the box, with no "break-in" period necessary. Perfect design, fair price, and excellent quality. I highly recommend these shoes for hiking and normal wear.
customer_reviews.author: C. Apley

customer_reviews.title: Great Work Boots
customer_reviews.text: I am pleasantly surprised by these boots as I have never owned a pair of Timberlands. I tend to ruin the toes of my boots when I am working around the house and yard because I am tall, so I tend to get on my knees a lot instead of bending over. I have been doing a lot of digging in our backyard recently and these boots have been supportive and comfortable, even through all of the abuse that I have been giving them. The soles seem like they will last a long time as they show no wear yet. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfectly but the right foot hurts afterwards
customer_reviews.text: Update: The shoes got more comfy and soft after some time, now they are perfect! Side note, they get scratched very easily, not a deal breaker though This shoes are amazing, comfortable, nice looking and waterproof! But, for some reason after I put them on and walk for some time the right foot hurts A LOT, I do not know if my right foot is thicker than the left one or what, but I have tried losing the strings a little and it hasn't work. I don't know what to do now. I love this shoes but I won't be able to use them too often if this keeps happening
customer_reviews.author: José A Nieto

customer_reviews.title: 3 days in
customer_reviews.text: I have only had them for a few days but so far I'm impressed. I do a lot of hiking and working outdoors so I go through boots pretty fast. These took a few hours for me to break in but are comfortable now. Sizing for me was pretty true to size and just slightly on the snug side which I like in a new boot so as it breaks in it fits my foot better. It's held up to heat from my motorcycle very well also.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Snipes

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Had a pair of Timberlands similar to these for about 3 years a while back. Tried a pair of Solomons, didnt make it to 2 years before the soles were separating and water was leaking in. They were never as comfortable, and cost about $40 more. These are awesome right out of the box, glad I bought another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great boot, great price
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about buying boots online without trying them on first, but these boots fit perfectly and are some of my favorite boots I've ever owned. I bought them specifically for a multinational trip where I'd be doing a lot of walking and some hiking. These things got me around cities, up mountains and along coastline trails. The waterproofness was perfect, I walked through puddles and in the ocean up to a couple of inches to clean the mud of them multiple times and my feet stayed dry. Very comfortable, sturdy for hiking and climbing, waterproof and best of all - great value compared to other boots out there.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Like to Hike
customer_reviews.text: Nice, sturdy boot. I wear a 10 and these felt a little small at first. My initial thought was to return them for a half-size larger. But, after wearing them for an hour, I grew to like the fit. I prefer a firm boot for hiking. Tried them out on a trail this morning and immediately found my stride. If you like a little wiggle room for your feet or are maybe thinking about wearing these in cold weather, you might go a 1/2 size up to accommodate heavier socks. Haven’t put these boots through the waterproof test yet.
customer_reviews.author: Miss B

customer_reviews.title: Loved the fit, not impressed with the wear
customer_reviews.text: These boots fit perfectly, they were snug but not tight and the lace and tongue arrangement allows a very comfortable fit, making long hikes fun wearing a secure fitting boot, that is waterproof and tread pattern that gives hiking confidence. What I didn't like is the wear - my hikes involve roads and trails and if your hike involves any amount of walking on roads, then I would not recommend these boots ... the consistency of the heel is too soft and will very rapidly wear down.
customer_reviews.author: Gerrit Reinders

customer_reviews.title: Great looking, durable boots are great for long walking
customer_reviews.text: These boots are very comfortable, durable, and look good. I walk around four miles a day, and these boots are the first pair I've found in a few years that I didn't feel the need to add a comfort insole. The boots have good shock absorption for long walks, and don't cause fatigue while standing for prolonged periods. The waterproofing seems adequate for regular rainy weather, although you may need additional waterproofing if you plan to walk through shallow water for longer periods. I would absolutely recommend Timberland boots for hiking and/or daily wear.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Perry

customer_reviews.title: WHAT HAPPENED TO TIMBERLAND?
customer_reviews.text: Timberland used to be a Go-To brand years ago. THIS, is not THAT. Not wasting my time whining about the undernourished boot tongue that doesn't cover the shank/ankle, the "wide" designation (JAJAJA-hilarious), the seemingly smooth inner sole until you put weight on it and it turns out to be lumpy. OOps. I just did whine about it. For tens buck less, the Kamik Fargo is the real deal. Sending these back. Had I not experienced the past Timeberland quality first-hand, I wouldn't be this disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Hobby Poppy

customer_reviews.title: Finally, A Good-Outdoor G.P.-Footwear.
customer_reviews.text: Thought I would NEVER-find a shoe in a semi-round, non-steel toe shoe, for basically-casual outdoor activity, For my-experience, the size was true to fit, plus the width was at least in staying within the sizing-parameters. And, the sole-tread design is not too-extreme, as in military-spec lugs. But rather a comfy-"civilian"-type balance of both. For anyone with half-size issues? It would be advisable to go with the next-FULL-size-UP, to allow for normal foot-swelling, esp. in summer-heat. And, they are indeed waterproof, at least up to the ankle, and heavily splash-proof from there up.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno To The Second Power

customer_reviews.title: Fits narrow
customer_reviews.text: Overall a nice boot - BUT if you wear and truly need a Wide width, you may want to look elsewhere. The wide in this boot fits like most medium width shoes/boots in my opinion. The toe in particular seems narrow. Also the overall quality is not what I’ve come to expect from Timberland. One of my boots squeaks noticeably with every step and on every type of surface including carpet and grass - so it’s not the rubber sole. But a decent boot overall for the price - just a bit below my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Roger C. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fall or winter hiking and backpacking boot
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to hiking boot. Its solidly built and it gives you confidence on long hikes with full gear. The boot lands and grips very well. Not super comfortable after insanely rugged hike with 40lb of gear but nothing is with that much weight and the type of terrain. Hiked a few washed out trails with steep hills on the side and the grip of these boots helped secure me after the jumping across. Other shoes may have ruined my day. Handles rough hiking very well and works as a hiking boot should. Its not my daily shoe but it works on rugged, slippery, wet and cold terrain for about 8 weeks out of the year very well.
customer_reviews.author: Nandizo

customer_reviews.title: Good basic boot
customer_reviews.text: I had some problems early on with rubbing on top of my foot right behind the big toes. A new pair of socks fixed that problem. Other than that one of the eyelets at the bottom came out early on but doesn't seem to affect anything greatly. It's been three months now and the bottom sole is starting to separate. This is about typical for me as these are everyday wear and I walk several miles a day at work...and go hiking and backpacking when I'm not there. The price was very good as I got the wheat colored style though I think I might spring for the dark brown next time.
customer_reviews.author: J_T_D

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of this exact model of Timberland boots. The first pair were great and lasted me many years. These ones, now made in China by the way, are already having problems after 5 months, with one of the eyelets on the top having ripped completely out, and several others having deformed from normal use. This is not from misuse as the older, non-Chinese versions of these have held up fine. Very disappointed. Update: returned these to Timberland (at my expense) and they replaced them. However, the new ones are having the exact same problem with the eyelets. No more Timberland for me.
customer_reviews.author: samuel goodman

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, not very durable.
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable boots I have had. I have had 2 pairs of the same boot. The sole came loose from the boot on both pairs after very moderate use. Trips to the shoe repairman fixed them, but I can't recommend them as a result. The shoe repair guy calls them "fashion boots" as opposed to real working or hiking boots. I thought the first pair was an anomaly, but the same thing happened to the 2nd pair. I'll pay more for better made boots in the future.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lahti

customer_reviews.title: Rugged and perform well.
customer_reviews.text: I am a landscape photographer and the worse the weather, the better the photography. I bought these specifically because I needed a rugged, comfortable, waterproof boot that can take punishment and keep me sure footed and my feet dry. These are very comfortable, they are waterproof and they hold up to rugged terrain and use. I climb rocks, hike mountains, navigate tide pools, sharp ocean rocks at low tide and wear them in cold conditions. Standing in a stream taking photos is a frequent thing I do, these boots are perfect. I will buy another pair soon so I can be assured when I need new ones I will have an extra pair.
customer_reviews.author: otter

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great boots for the price if you're going to submerge them in water
customer_reviews.text: We use these boots to walk into a river to do photography. Rather than wearing water shoes or waders, we wear these boots so that we can hike in and out to the river itself (about 3/4 of a mile). Over time, these boots will eventually fall apart, but you can probably do this 50 times or so before that happens. These hold up better than expensive 200+ dollar REI boots for that task, because it's made with what seems like one big piece of fabric, so there aren't a ton of places for it to come apart.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Hastings

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoe
customer_reviews.text: With all the quarantining, hiking seems to be my new go-to thing to do. These shoes have been tested twice now (aside from breaking them in walking around the neighborhood). They truly are good, tough shoes. You dont feel sharp rocks or boulders when stepping on them, and no water has gotten into the shoes even when stepping into a puddle or stream. I have had them about three weeks, they fit as expected and seem quite durable. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Nicoll

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots to wear while riding my motorcycle because they offer ankle support. Ankle protection is very important for motorcyclists. I wore them on a 200+ ride the first day I received them and was very pleased with the comfort and fit. They actually felt like they were broken in right out of the gate. The shift pedal did not scuff the top of the boot at all which is rare as most motorcycle specific boots have a scuff pad where the shift pedal meets the top of the boot. No need for that with these boots. I'm totally satisfied with the boots and will be recommending them to other riders.
customer_reviews.author: Randall J. Love

customer_reviews.title: Great walking and motorcycle boots.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as low in height motorcycle boots that I could spend all day in and do quite a bit of walking as well. These fit the bill perfectly. I bought them spent a few days walking and riding and then spent 12 straight days working a motorcycle event 12-16 hours a day in these boots. Not issues whatsoever. No blisters and they wore great. My feet got hot but what do you expect, some talc in the socks took care of that. I can't yet speak to the durability but out the box these did awesome for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne

customer_reviews.title: still fit great out of the box
customer_reviews.text: still fit great out of the box , but the stitching is not the same as in the past . i have bought 3 pair of these and this last pair are the black ones they are not as good of a boot as the other brown ones that i have bought in the past . the strings dont stay tied at all . they are waterproof and comfortable . the soles are still very good and well attached to the shoes . i wear these most everyday and work in them . i wouldn't pay 100 bucks for them again but they are well worth 70
customer_reviews.author: brandon bishop

customer_reviews.title: No quality
customer_reviews.text: I never leave Amazon reviews because I don't take the time - but this order pist me off because these shoes fell apart within weeks. The soles have simply fallen off and I don't think my fiancé is out there doing jumping jacks all day. I don't know how in the world there are so many positive Amazon reviews on these boots is beyond me. NOT WATERPROOF. LOW QUALITY. WASTE OF MONEY. Notice - you can't return these boots after one month (just saying!) save your money. don't buy these boots if you're a hard working dude.
customer_reviews.author: Danyelle Sarkozi

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking boots, very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: The only disappointment is that the soles wear out quicker than I would like. I expect a pair of boots to last about a year. It is through the black outer sole and into the gray in a bunch of spots. I do walk a couple of miles a day most day's so that's also a factor. They are very comfortable. I would just wish the sole was a little more durable. The upper is made very well with hi quality leather, just wish the sole was as good.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory K

customer_reviews.title: Tight collar above ankle
customer_reviews.text: As a Floridian, it may not be ideal in this climate, but so far the only complaint I have is the bulky collar at the top of the boot which chafes above my ankle making lacing all the way up very uncomfortable. So far I've tolerated it by not using the top hooks, but even that is only less discomfort. They may break in and be no problem, but if it persists I will hack that bulky collar off. Otherwise if seems to be a fine boot.
customer_reviews.author: Moose

customer_reviews.title: I brought these boots for my son for work he has a wide foot and wears a size 12....
customer_reviews.text: I brought these boots for my son, he has a wide foot and wears a size 12 but I brought him a size 13 and some extra insoles for some extra cushion and because they are a little narrow in the toe area, I decided to go with a size 13. They fit him great. He works in food service where he is normally doing extra hours or on his feet all day. He has no complaints with these boots. I think that I will buy more.
customer_reviews.author: JIGGLYPUFF

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to do yard work primarily. Walking around the yard, mowing, weed eating, tree trimming... all of that jazz. I bought these and immediately put them through the grind. I walked through thick undergrowth, mud, dead trees, etc. and these held up very well. I did this for three plus hours two days in a row brand new out of the box. My feet felt great and the boots held up well. I will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Love these. 2 pair over 10 years.
customer_reviews.text: Light. Supporting. Great for walking, hiking. I've hiked many rocky mountain trails. Been on many international mission trips. These are my primary footware for active outings. After I break them in, they are like high top sneakers. Metal eyes and loops. Big plus. Very gripping sole. Real leather. I have worn 2 pair over 10 years. Starting my 3rd pair. 2nd pair are not done yet. Still have another 6 months or so on them.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Wide Version perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: Ankle boot sizes I don't normally have to do a wide version. I'm an 11.5 normally and the 11.5 W fit perfectly. If you have even slightly wider than normal feet I'd get the W version. Waterproof perfectly out of the box. Comfortable enough to wear all day whether working and walking or sitting down at a desk. Haven't tested outside of winter but I'd say to get more of a breathable cloth boot for hiking. Will update later on. Overall completely satisfied and 10/10 Fit, 10/10 function, and 10/10 style. Its a good inbetween some of the more stylized boots and a work boot. Works well for both.
customer_reviews.author: Ian T.

customer_reviews.title: Great casual boot.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second or third pair, first from Amazon. They changed them a bit (Timberland). The ankle foam and foot cushion inside too. Nothing too drastic but another sign of a company lowering the quality for the same priced product. All and all, still a great boot. Waterproof until the end with my last pair too.
customer_reviews.author: j.d.

customer_reviews.title: Possibly used?  Maybe returned? No original packaging sent, no tags.
customer_reviews.text: I received an prime box with the boots inside. No original box, or tags. Buyer Beware you may receive used/returned items in a prime box with a unhelpful message printed on it's cover claiming the original packaging was "damaged in transit" Hard to believe when the tags have been removed. First and time I've had anything arrive in this condition from amazon. Looks like a returned item sold to me as "new"
customer_reviews.author: David Russell

customer_reviews.title: Not really for us flat foots
customer_reviews.text: I needed some cheaper waterproof work boots ASAP so I picked these up mostly due to size and delivery timeframe. They’re good shoes, they stand up to water extremely well. They are not at all comfortable to me though. I have terry flat feet and the arches and shape of these shoes just disagree with me. They’re good work boots, the quality seems great I’ve had mine in water several times already. Just the fitting is not what I would personally need.
customer_reviews.author: influence peddler

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots with no break in period
customer_reviews.text: I've bought Timberland boots similar to these in the past, and have always been satisfied. These fit as expected. They have a little more cushion around the top of the tongue. That makes lacing them straight a bit more difficult, but well worth it for the feel. I climbed a small volcano crater and did several miles hiking in the snow. My feet stayed dry and warm, and they give you a secure feel. I have week ankles, and these did a great job at stabilizing them.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: It will keep your feet warm and dry
customer_reviews.text: I received made in Vietnam version, and it seemed they made it pretty well. I found no major issue in stitching or sizing. The built quality was pretty good for $70 shoes. The shoes are waterproof that will keep your feet warm and dry in the harsh weather condition. We had winter storm last month where i live, and it always kept my feet dry and warm during the wet season. Although the shoes were extensively exposed to water, it didnt have any issue like deformation or decolorization on the shoes. The only downside is that it may feel little sturdy at first, but it gets more comfortable as you wear it more often.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots but cheaply made!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this boots from here because I read some positive reviews.My husbands shoe size is a nine but I read that that they run small so I got half size bigger.Anyway I received them last week and my husband wore them 2 times to work and the day we got snow.So only 3 times and the glue came off the front. I am so disappointed because I had already thrown the box in the trash and how can I return them without a box. I hope this review helps others. This was my experience with my defective pair.
customer_reviews.author: Margarita😍

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable enough, mostly waterproof, and good quality construction
customer_reviews.text: I use these boots for working at a car wash in very wet, soapy, and slippery conditions. It’s been a month since I started wearing them. These boots are in fact waterproof; the crease along your toes where the boot bends(pictured above) squeezes water the leather absorbed out of the boot leather and into where you put your foot so your feet will end up wet at the end of 8 hours in water. They haven’t leaked but even treated with Sno-Seal, water enters through the pores of the leather where it creases. Overall I’m more than happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for hiking and waited too long so I only had one day to break them in. Well they didn't need it. They fit perfect and for day 1 I wore them at home for about 4 hours. Day two was a 3 mile hike over varied terrain and these boots performed great. Comfortable, non slip, water resistant. [did not test them but for a minute] and overall a great boot. I would get a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: P. Altenburg

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money for an everyday shoe
customer_reviews.text: My husband loved these boots when he first put them on and still to this day loves the comfort of these boots. However the quality is what cost these boots not to be 5 stars. After everyday wear for him for only 2 months they have become flimsy and the toe area is lifting from the sole. For the cost and brand we are very disappointed. Now with winter on the way he now has to buy another pair definitely won’t be these again.
customer_reviews.author: Tbene

customer_reviews.title: Great boots at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: This boots are great for the price and I like the fact that they are comfortable. I am a mechanic, so I have to be on my feet for most of the day and these boots feel like sneakers. They are not too slippery on at surface but you still need to be careful with them. You can still slip on at surface of your not careful. All and all, I love these boots and I bought another one for going out, that's how much I like these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Amado A. Khoury

customer_reviews.title: Uppers wear out fast
customer_reviews.text: They fit quite well and are quite comfortable. The laces are terrible because they kept coming off on a hike. But there is a solution for that which will work out quite well (search "lock laces"). I have worn the boots on only one moderately difficult hike ~5-6 miles, and they got so beat up and look worn out, it is unbelievable! Maybe they'll last long, but won't look good for sure. The design is a little plain and unattractive. You can find better quality boots that also look good elsewhere for cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: M. Pise

customer_reviews.title: Steal at this price
customer_reviews.text: These boots fit as expected, are waterproof, and comfortable. I was afraid these boots would be too stiff, as I planned to use them for hiking and my daily long walks with my dog. But they are surprisingly comfortable. These boots were selling between $80-$100 at upstate NY shoe stores, so these were a steal at $51. I had to settle for my second choice of color, but still a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: albanydc

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful boots. Just got done with a trip in France thst involved a lot of walking through a lot of rain. Walked well over 30 miles in cities, through fields and on beaches, all while it was raining. Never got a blister, had sore feet, or had damp socks once. These boots were worth the investment for just that trip alone. I am a huge fan of wolverine. My work boots for welding are wolverine and I own a pair of 1000 mile boots. I highly recommend these boots for someone looking for decently priced hiking boots that are waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Harlan Brown

customer_reviews.title: “Waste Of Money!”...
customer_reviews.text: I tried to buy these to save money from the normal $160 work shoes I buy. But the toe is starting to come unglued after only a months use. I also have less ventilation in these shoes compared to my old Salomon’s. Due to the extra moisture and less ventilation my feet now “smell like hard work” when I take my shoes off. I’ll give these another months use if the toe last that long and then go back to what I know works...
customer_reviews.author: MiNuS31

customer_reviews.title: I love these boots
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. I've been wearing these for a couple of weeks on a daily basis to "break" them in for my Everest Trek to the base camp in a couple of months and so far they feel great. The first week I was having a slight pain with my little toe on the right foot but after a week and conditioning with Mink oil no more issues. I've done several hikes in the Lake Tahoe area with them and they have been really good. Good traction and keeps my feet warm and dry. These should work perfectly for the Nepal climate on Mt. Everest.
customer_reviews.author: STeven Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Obviously these aren't top flight hiking boots but they are very good mid range boots, which is what they are prices as and represented as. So I give them five stars for being represented as, and priced as, what they are. And unlike another pair I bought at the same time, different brand, they are indeed waterproof. Soft, light, waterproof and moderately priced. For me that's a win.
customer_reviews.author: brokeboater

customer_reviews.title: Fit and finish are good. They have good support - I have walked ...
customer_reviews.text: My initial reaction to these boots is very positive; only time will tell if they last. I was very surprised when my wife handed me the box - I thought that something must be wrong, the box was WAY too light for a pair of boots. Nope, they were both in the box - so they are incredibly light to me. Fit and finish are good. They have good support - I have walked a decent bit in them and my feet feel good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fair low cost boot very light
customer_reviews.text: these seem cheap. only had for almost 2 months. i do not expect them to last very long, i dont know yet. if theu last 2 years ill be happy. i jad nike goadome airs, best most comfertable bpot o jabe eber worn. lasted over 3 years amd are still wearable. i work a lot as a delibery driver, average 100hrs everu 2 weeks. so the boots go through a lot. jad i known these werrnt half as good. i woild have spent the 150 to 200 dollars. 3 tomes more confertable and inmnow they will take a beating and last.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M.

customer_reviews.title: Look great, narrow
customer_reviews.text: Order the wide version even if you think you don't wear the wide version. These are very narrow, as you can see in other reviews. I have the same standard size in many shoes and different boots, however these are a lot narrower. The wide would probably be more like a normal. I don't know how much they will spread over time as I just got them. I am going to deal with the standard version but even if you've never needed a wide version, get the 2E wide version anyway. These are small boots compared to other boots like these, such as wolverine boots.
customer_reviews.author: LoganTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: This boats come apart after 2 usage
customer_reviews.text: This hiking Boats are comfortable but after 2x using it on a 2 hour hike the boats are coming apart. I feel if I use it one more time on a hike it will come apart. If you looking for hiking boats this are not it..
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: Scuffed on arrival
customer_reviews.text: The boots came scuffed out from the box. Idk if they got damaged while getting shipped or is it from the seller’s end. But they had clear scratch marks on both pair. If I wasn’t gonna use them for yard work and hiking. I would've returned them right away. And i can see other buyers had the same problem as well. So please be advised. Other than that, the boots are very comfortable and light on the feet. P.S; buy a size bigger than your regular shoe size.
customer_reviews.author: Ezz E

customer_reviews.title: Not WIDE
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the WIDE last year in brown- perfect fit. Ordered the WIDE this month in black- much too narrow from heel to toe. Obvious right out of the box. Couldn't even get them laced because they hurt just putting my foot in! So, I looked at the label inside the brown ones from last year and they were made in Vietnam. But, these black boots are made in Cambodia. So, it would seem that the Cambodian factory has a manufacturing issue. Disappointing. Amazon took them right back though. No problem there.
customer_reviews.author: Dbkamp4

customer_reviews.title: Back of leg/ankle bruised (hurts)
customer_reviews.text: I have several pairs of Timberlands; it was almost like I collected the brand in my lifetime. This pair, the back of my leg at the ankle area was bruised and hurt. I thought I had to break it in but it has been 6 days. That part of my leg ONLY HURTS WHEN I wear this boot. I am returning it. Break in time should not have taken this long. I wore it for 6 days at least 8 hours a day. That part of my leg is dark due to the bruising. Not sure if they are authentic or not.
customer_reviews.author: TheKatzMeow

customer_reviews.title: Passed the Iceland Test
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots specifically for a trip to Iceland. Since the weather by me was very warm, I did not get a chance to properly break them in before-hand. Even without the proper break-in, these boots did an amazing job. They handled walking/hiking 5-10 miles per day without my feet hurting, kept my feet warm and dry while walking inside of and on top of a glacier, and helped me stay stable while doing some basic climbing. I am super impressed with these boots, and am very glad I bought them. Now for the next test, surviving Chicago winters.
customer_reviews.author: icedearth15324

customer_reviews.title: Great boot for the price..
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for the husband for winter season (UPS driver). He had new Danners last year that are leaking this year and his feet were getting wet. So I took a chance and ordered these boots for him to try another brand. First day wearing them, he called from work and said that these boots are great! He likes them better than his Danners and that they are way more comfortable. More like a sneaker feel than a boot feel. They kept his feet dry all day and he also said to order a second pair for when these wear out. :)
customer_reviews.author: sidney king

customer_reviews.title: Very discomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several pairs before in warehouse shoe sale and they been magnificent but this pair I bought in Amazon they are giving me too much pain near the fibula. It's on the upper part of the foot that I am feeling the discomfort and I've already used 4 days straight and still feel uncomfortable so I gave them away. The quality of the shoes are not the same as I've bought before on the store.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!!
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice boots. As You would expect from Timberland. Nice soles, and very waterproof. I walk a lot in heavy rain, and strong winds. Lots of boots can't handle it, but these can. Thanks. Update! After wearing these for awhile they started killing my feet the fourth mile, and leaked. Even with six coats of waterproofing sprayed on them. Through the bottom of the tongue I think.
customer_reviews.author: MarkT

customer_reviews.title: My feet and ankles are very happy with this choice
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed so far. Wearing as work boots for yardwork and digging. Wanted the boot for the sole as my feet were killing me from stomping on a shovel repeatedly. Much better in the boots, and they are comfortable enough that I'm now using them for everyday outdoor tasks/chores. My feet and ankles are very happy with this choice. I hope they last as long as the seem they will.
customer_reviews.author: BillArch2

customer_reviews.title: Sad Pair of Boots
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these in dark brown around 4 years ago, and they were very nice quality boots for the same price as these in black. I just received this pair of black boots, and was terribly disappointed. There is a major negative quality change between the 2 pairs within the last 4 years. I'm sending them back for a refund, and will find another pair of boots somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Boots
customer_reviews.text: I went on line looking for a comfortable pair of boots that would also keep my feet dry. I'm a contractor and a hunter with bad feet. I had 6 different surgeries total on both feet and my feet get fatigued fast. I decided i would take a chance on these. I took them out of the box , laced them up and wore them every ware ( work, hiking, hunting, Shopping, Driving) for a month. I have never been so happy over foot ware in my life. There was no brake in time. I was so happy that I bought a 2nd after the 30 days to save until I ware these out. 5 stare product for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy H

product_meta.title: Timberland Men's White Ledge Mid Waterproof Ankle Boot
product_meta.description:
Uppers made with 100% premium waterproof leather from an LWG Silver-rated tannery. Seam-sealed construction. Rustproof, speed lace hardware with lace hooks at top. Fully gusseted tongue. EVA footbed. EVA midsole. Solid rubber outsole with multi-directional lugs.

You're sure to have an outdoor positive experience when you have these waterproof boots on your feet. They're comfortable, durable and great looking.

Timberland set new industry standards for craftsmanship, durability and protection when it introduced an authentic, waterproof leather boot in 1973. A global leader in design, engineering and marketing of premium footwear, Timberland values consumers who cherish the outdoors and their time in it. Timberland has been an industry leader in the use of both sustainable and recycled materials in its shoes, as well as its footwear packaging. The Timberland Company believes in corporate responsibility and supports numerous civic and social projects throughout the year.

See more
feature_bullets: Our White Ledge Men's Hiking Boots have premium full-grain waterproof leather uppers, seam-sealed waterproof construction, and rustproof speed lace hardware with hooks at top for secure lacing.
